meanings.definition: Falling behind in movement or progress.
meanings.sent1: The tired runner was lagging behind the others in the race.
meanings.sent2: The slow turtle was lagging behind the fast rabbit.
meanings.sent3: The lagging snail finally crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent4: Her lagging computer struggled to keep up with the new software.
meanings.sent5: The lagging student needed extra help to catch up with the class.

meanings.definition: Material used for covering or insulating pipes.
meanings.sent1: The workers installed the lagging around the hot pipes.
meanings.sent2: The lagging prevented the pipes from losing heat.
meanings.sent3: The lagging on the pipes looked like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The lagging material kept the temperature stable inside the pipes.
meanings.sent5: The old lagging needed to be replaced to improve insulation.

meanings.definition: The act of slowing down or delaying.
meanings.sent1: The lagging of the train caused a delay in the schedule.
meanings.sent2: The lagging of the internet connection made it hard to work.
meanings.sent3: The lagging of time made the meeting start later than planned.
meanings.sent4: The lagging of the project deadline led to overtime work.
meanings.sent5: The lagging of the traffic made everyone late for the event.
